chain.description: Based on the user's request, I need to find a family-friendly TV show with a high IMDb rating and check its streaming availability on Netflix, Disney+, and Apple TV. Additionally, I should provide information about the show's cast and crew. To accomplish this, I will make use of the "search_pro_for_streaming_availability" function from the "streaming_availability" tool. By passing the arguments for the country as "US", services as "Netflix, Disney+, Apple TV", show type as "series", and ordering by IMDb rating in descending order, I can retrieve the desired information.

chain.observation: {"error": "Unsubscribed error...", "response": "{'message': 'You are not subscribed to this API.'}"}

function.name: additional_title_details_for_ott_details
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "ott_details", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get  additional details for a movie or tv show like reviews  , quotes , plotsummary , number of votes , trailer url  , cast details etc."

function.name: basic_info_for_ott_details
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "ott_details", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get info on a  cast such as name , profession , birth and death year , bio , poster , best titles  etc."

function.name: title_details_for_ott_details
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "ott_details", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get basic information on a movie or tv show such as imdbid , title , genre , runtime , imdbrating , language , synopsis , type , imageurl  , Streaming platforms info etc."

function.name: get_basic_free_for_streaming_availability
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "streaming_availability", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get the details of a show via IMDb or TMDb id, including the streaming availability info in the given country."

output_language.description: 2 letter iso code of the output language. Default is `en`. See the about page to see the list of languages supported.

function.name: search_pro_for_streaming_availability
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "streaming_availability", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Search through the catalog of the given services in the given country. Provides filters such as show language, genre and keyword. Items per page is 10. Output includes all the information about the shows, such as title, IMDb ID, TMDb ID, IMDb rating, link "

country.description: 2 letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code of the country to search in. See the about page to check the supported countries.

services.description:
A comma separated list of up to 8 services to search in. See `/v2/services` endpoint to get the supported services and their ids/names.

Syntax of the values supplied in the list can be as the followings:

`<sevice_id>`: Searches in the entire catalog of t

year_max.description: Maximum release/air year of the show.

cursor.description: Cursor is used for pagination. After each request, the response includes a `hasMore` boolean field to tell if there are more results that did not fit the returned list size. If it is set as true, to get the rest of the result set, send a new request (with

desc.description:
Use descending order?

Possible values are `true` and `false`. Default value is `false`.

genres_relation.description:
When more than one genre is supplied in `genres` parameter, `genres_relation` chooses the matching style against

When `or`, the endpoint returns any show that has at least one of the given genres.
When `and`, it only returns the shows that have all of the

year_min.description: Minimum release/air year of the show.

show_original_language.description: A 2 letter ISO 639-1 language code to only search within the shows whose original language matches with the provided language.

genres.description:
Comma separated list of genre ids to only search within the shows in those genres. See `/v2/genres` endpoint to see available genres and ids.

show_type.description: Type of shows to search in. Accepted values are `movie`, `series` or `all`. The default value is `all`.

order_by.description:
Determines the ordering of the results.

Possible values are `original_title` and `year`. Default value is `original_title`

output_language.description: 2 letter iso code of the output language. Default is `en`. See the about page to see the list of languages supported.

keyword.description: A keyword to only search within the shows have that keyword in their overview or title.

function.name: person_for_watchmode
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "watchmode", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Return details on a specific person (actor, director, etc)."

function.name: title_cast_crew_for_watchmode
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "watchmode", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Return all people associated with the title, the "cast" (actors), and "crew" (directors, writers, cinematographers, etc). For more details on a person, pass the person-id to the /person/ endpoint."

is_id.description:
This ID can be the Watchmode ID of the title (returned by other endpoints such as the list-titles endpoint), or found in the mapping file: https://api.watchmode.com/datasets/title_id_map.csv.

You can also pass an IMDB ID here instead, or a TMDB type and T

function.name: streaming_release_dates_for_watchmode

Only major services and US releases dates included, however most of the major services (Netflix, Hulu, etc) release original content on the same days in all countri"

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"

answer_generation.query: I need to find a new TV show to watch with my family. Can you suggest a family-friendly series with a high IMDb rating and check its streaming availability on Netflix, Disney+, and Apple TV? Additionally, provide information about the show's cast and crew.
